page.title: 11A TYPICAL FARMER'S DAY
page.content:
The mixed farm at{Crift}is typical of the 9 farms to the West of the river Lynher. Here is{Mr Bunkum's daily routine:-
{5.30am} get up, have a cup of tea. {5.50am }round up the 48 milking cows. {6.00am }milk cows 4 at a time. {7.30am }feed calves. {7.45am }Milk Marketing Board tanker collects days quota of milk. {8.00am }have breakfast. {8.30am }clean milking parlour. {9.00am-4.30pm}general work around the { }farm. Breaks around 11.00 am (crib) and 1.00 pm (lunch). {4.30pm }milk cows again. {6.00pm }check calves. {6.30pm }have tea. {7.00pm }relax. Perhaps read or watch television. {10.00pm}go to bed.
